> I=
n response to Derek's Question -
> 
> > 3. Can I setup SharpNeat to only ev=
olve the topology of a 
network,
> > > and determine the weights with tradi=
tional back prop ANN 
training?
> > >
> > Why would you necessarily want to=
 do that?
> 
> I want to be able to seperate the weight evolution, because =
one of 
> experiments I want to try is numeric prediction, and from reading=
 
> around the internet, it seems that solving this type of problem it 
is =

> best to find the weights based on one set of training data, but 
> valid=
ate the network on an second set of data.  There may be other 
> ways to do=
 this with NEAT, while still allowing NEAT to evolve the 
> weights, but I =
don't know enough about the algorithms yet - I have 
to 
> play with it / r=
ead for a while.
> 

Mike, you can do that with NEAT alone.  What you do is=
 evaluate each 
generation on the training set and test the champion of eac=
h 
generation on the validation set.  When the validation scores start 
goi=
ng down, you stop evolution.

That said, it is still viable to combine NEAT=
 with backprop as well, 
as some people have done, but it is not necessary.=


ken

> Thanks Again!
> Mike
